00047 //=============================================================================
00048 // CLASS sc_spawn_object<T>
00049 //
00050 // This templated helper class allows an object to provide the execution 
00051 // semantics for a process via its () operator. An instance of the supplied 
00052 // execution object will be kept to provide the semantics when the process is 
00053 // scheduled for execution. The () operator does not return a value. An example 
00054 // of an object that might be used for this helper function would be void 
00055 // sc_bind bound function or method.
00056 //
00057 // This class is derived from sc_process_host and overloads 
00058 // sc_process_host::semantics to provide the actual semantic content. 
00059 //
00060 //   sc_spawn_object(T object, const char* name, const sc_spawn_options* opt_p)
00061 //     This is the object instance constructor for this class. It makes a
00062 //     copy of the supplied object. The tp_call constructor is called
00063 //     with an indication that this object instance should be reclaimed when
00064 //     execution completes.
00065 //         object   =  object whose () operator will be called to provide
00066 //                     the process semantics.
00067 //         name_p   =  optional name for object instance, or zero.
00068 //         opt_p    -> spawn options or zero.
00069 //
00070 //   virtual void semantics()
00071 //     This virtual method provides the execution semantics for its process.
00072 //     It performs a () operation on m_object.
00073 //=============================================================================
00074 template<typename T>
00075 class sc_spawn_object : public sc_process_host {
00076   public:
00077     sc_spawn_object( T object) : m_object(object)
00078     {
00079     }
00080 
00081     virtual void semantics()
00082     {
00083         m_object();
00084     }
00085 
00086   protected:
00087     T                        m_object;
00088 };
00089 
00090 
00091 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00092 //"sc_spawn - semantic object with no return value"
00093 //
00094 // This inline function spawns a process for execution. The execution semantics 
00095 // for the process being spawned will be provided by the supplied object 
00096 // instance via its () operator. (E.g., an sc_bind bound function)
00097 // After creating the process it is registered with the simulator.
00098 //     object   =   object instance providing the execution semantics via its 
00099 //                  () operator.
00100 //     name_p   =   optional name for object instance, or zero.
00101 //     opt_p    ->  optional spawn options for process, or zero for the default.
00102 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00103 template <typename T>
00104 inline sc_process_handle sc_spawn( 
00105     T object, 
00106     const char* name_p = 0,
00107     const sc_spawn_options* opt_p = 0)
00108 {
00109     sc_simcontext*      context_p;
00110     sc_spawn_object<T>* spawn_p;
00111     
00112     context_p = sc_get_curr_simcontext();
00113     spawn_p = new sc_spawn_object<T>(object);
00114     if ( !opt_p || !opt_p->is_method() )
00115     {
00116             sc_process_handle thread_handle = context_p->create_thread_process( 
00117             name_p, true,
00118             SC_MAKE_FUNC_PTR(sc_spawn_object<T>,semantics), 
00119             spawn_p, opt_p 
00120         );
00121         return thread_handle;
00122     }
00123     else
00124     {
00125             sc_process_handle method_handle = context_p->create_method_process( 
00126             name_p, true,
00127             SC_MAKE_FUNC_PTR(sc_spawn_object<T>,semantics), 
00128             spawn_p, opt_p 
00129         );
00130         return method_handle;
00131     }
00132 }

00134 //=============================================================================
00135 // CLASS sc_spawn_object_v<T> for all compilers except HP aCC
00136 //              or
00137 // CLASS sc_spawn_object_v<T, R> for HP aCC which tries to match this 
00138 // one template argument class when the sc_spawn() declared above is
00139 // invoked with 3 arguments or 2 arguments, and generates compiler errors.
00140 //
00141 // This templated helper class allows an object to provide the execution 
00142 // semantics for a process via its () operator. An instance of the supplied 
00143 // object will be kept to provide the semantics when the process is scheduled 
00144 // for execution. The () operator returns a value, which will be stored at the 
00145 // location specified by the supplied pointer. An example of an object that 
00146 // might be used for this helper function would be valued sc_bind bound
00147 // function or method. 
00148 //
00149 //   sc_spawn_object_v( typename F::result_type* r_p, T f, const char* name_p,
00150 //                      const sc_spawn_options* opt_p )
00151 //       r_p      -> where to place the result of the function invocation.
00152 //       f        =  information to be executed.
00153 //       name_p   =  optional name for object instance, or zero.
00154 //       opt_p    -> optional spawn options for process, or zero for the default
00155 //     This is the object instance constructor for this class. It makes a
00156 //     copy of the supplied object. The tp_call constructor is called
00157 //     with an indication that this object instance should be reclaimed when
00158 //     execution completes.
00159 //         result_p -> where to place the value of the () operator.
00160 //         object   =  object whose () operator will be called to provide
00161 //                     the process semantics.
00162 //
00163 //   virtual void semantics()
00164 //     This virtual method provides the execution semantics for its process.
00165 //     It performs a () operation on m_object, placing the result at m_result_p.
00166 //=============================================================================
00167 
00168 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00169 //"sc_spawn_object_v - semantic object with return value"
00170 //
00171 // This inline function spawns a process for execution. The execution semantics 
00172 // for the process being spawned will be provided by the supplied object 
00173 // instance via its () operator. (E.g., an sc_bind bound function) That
00174 // operator returns a value, which will be placed in the supplied return 
00175 // location. 
00176 // After creating the process it is registered with the simulator.
00177 //     object   =  object instance providing the execution semantics via its () 
00178 //                 operator.
00179 //     r_p      -> where to place the value of the () operator.
00180 //     name_p   =  optional name for object instance, or zero.
00181 //     opt_p    -> optional spawn options for process, or zero for the default.
00182 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
